comments:
Inadequate error message from SDO

When setting a 'Float' property with a 'Double' value, I get a
class cast exception deep within Ecore. There is no data put
into the class cast, so a user without a debugger has no chance
of finding the cause.

Here is a stack trace:

java.lang.ClassCastException
       at 
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EStructuralFeatureImpl$InternalSettingDelegateSingle
DataUnsettableStatic.validate(EStructuralFeatureImpl.java:2035)
       at 
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EStructuralFeatureImpl$InternalSettingDelegateSingle
DataUnsettable.dynamicSet(EStructuralFeatureImpl.java:1956)
       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eDynamicSet
(BasicEObjectImpl.java:519)
       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eSet
(BasicEObjectImpl.java:503)
       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.set(SDOUtil.java:902)
       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.set(SDOUtil.java:121)
       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.setDouble(SDOUtil.java:252)
       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.EDataObjectImpl.setDouble
(EDataObjectImpl.java:478)
       at webservicesdoc.Example1.buildResponse(Example1.java:97)
       at webservicesdoc.Example1.main(Example1.java:51)

In my case, the local variables look like this:

this= 
EStructuralFeatureImpl$InternalSettingDelegateSingleDataUnsettableStatic  
(id=58)
  - dataClass= Class (java.lang.Float) (id=67)

object= Double  (id=60)
The improvements are committed to CVS.
The fix is available in the latest build.
